channel.title: Messing with NPC's
channel.description:
[b]Purpose:[/b] Changing NPC's =P [b]Difficulty:[/b] 1/100 [b]Required:[/b] Class5.java and if you want NPC.cfg
Messing with NPC's (changing name, examine text,..) is pretty easy! [b]---First step---[/b] Open up your class5.java. You will see things like: [code]if(i == ****) { Some things... }[/code] You need to replace the '****' with the ID from the NPC that you wanne change. You need to replace the 'Some things...' with a code.
[b]---Second step---[/b] This is an example of a code that you need to enter between the brackets: [code]class5.aString65 = "Noob"; //Name class5.aByteArray89 = "Omg it's a noob!".getBytes(); //Examine class5.anInt86 = 300; //Height class5.anInt91 = 50; //Width class5.anInt61 = 3; //Combat level[/code]
- aString65 is for the NPC name. - aByteArray89 is for the text if you examine an NPC. - You can resize your NPC with anInt86 && anInt91. - anInt61 is for changing the combat level.
The NPC's name will be "Noob", if you examine him the text "Omg it's a noob!" will appear, he will taller & smaller, and his combat lvl will be 3.
You can change the hp too, but thats server-side!
Just open NPC.cfg or however it's called on your source, and most times its the second number after the name.
I know, it's a small tutorial, but i think it's nice for people that don't know this.

item.title: Messing with NPC's
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“the1337legend, post:7, topic:299278”][quote author=Tatemo link=topic=395617.msg2942164#msg2942164 date=1251950298]
This is shit. Sorry. There are about 20 turtorials on how to create ints. You have only even mentioned 4 lines that can be changed. Did you know there are over 20 different lines you can change to make it do different things?
[/quote]
what she said ^^[/quote]

SHE!!! FUCK YOU

Read full topic

item.title: Messing with NPC's
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I don’t see why you’d hard code something like this. Just use Tom’s Cache Suite and look at the config files. It’s not like there’s pointers or compression, so it’s pretty easy to edit. When it doubt, just look at the ReadValues method for that specific file.

Read full topic

item.title: Messing with NPC's
item.dc:creator: @catthoor catthoor
item.description:
@catthoor wrote:

Purpose: Changing NPC’s =P
Difficulty: 1/100
Required: Class5.java and if you want NPC.cfg

Messing with NPC’s (changing name, examine text,…) is pretty easy!
—First step—
Open up your class5.java.
You will see things like:

if(i == ****) { Some things... }
You need to replace the ‘****’ with the ID from the NPC that you wanne change.
You need to replace the ‘Some things…’ with a code.

—Second step—
This is an example of a code that you need to enter between the brackets:

class5.aString65 = "Noob"; //Name class5.aByteArray89 = "Omg it's a noob!".getBytes(); //Examine class5.anInt86 = 300; //Height class5.anInt91 = 50; //Width class5.anInt61 = 3; //Combat level

  • aString65 is for the NPC name.
  • aByteArray89 is for the text if you examine an NPC.
  • You can resize your NPC with anInt86 && anInt91.
  • anInt61 is for changing the combat level.

The NPC’s name will be “Noob”, if you examine him the text “Omg it’s a noob!” will appear, he will taller & smaller, and his combat lvl will be 3.

You can change the hp too, but thats server-side!

Just open NPC.cfg or however it’s called on your source, and most times its the second number after the name.

I know, it’s a small tutorial, but i think it’s nice for people that don’t know this.

Read full topic
